scope: REST API for product search with filters

risks.title: SQL Injection via Search Parameters
risks.question: What if search query or filter parameters contain SQL injection payloads?
risks.impact: Unauthorized database access. Data exfiltration. Potential data deletion or modification. Complete database compromise.

risks.title: No Rate Limiting on Search Endpoint
risks.question: What if malicious users send thousands of complex search requests per second?
risks.impact: Database exhaustion from expensive queries. API resource depletion. Service degradation for legitimate users. Potential DoS.

risks.title: Unbounded Result Set Size
risks.question: What if pagination is bypassed or limit parameter set to extremely high values?
risks.impact: Memory exhaustion from loading massive result sets. Database query timeouts. API response timeout. Server crash under load.

risks.title: Missing Index on Filtered Columns
risks.question: What if filter columns lack database indexes causing full table scans?
risks.impact: Degraded query performance as data grows. Slow API responses. Database CPU spikes. Query timeouts in production.

risks.title: No Authentication Required
risks.question: What if the search API is publicly accessible without authentication?
risks.impact: Unlimited data scraping. Competitive intelligence gathering. API abuse without accountability. Rate limit bypass via multiple IPs.

risks.title: Complex Filter Combinations Not Tested
risks.question: What if users combine multiple filters in ways that create expensive query plans?
risks.impact: Unexpected slow queries from complex filter joins. Database load spikes. Poor user experience on specific filter combinations.

risks.title: No Cache-Control Headers
risks.question: What if identical search queries aren't cached and hit the database every time?
risks.impact: Repeated database queries for common searches. Higher server load. Increased response times. Unnecessary infrastructure costs.
